botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts are highly toxic by ingestion, sap may irritate skin and eyes. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Euphorbia can be annuals, perennials, shrubs or succulents, with milky sap and small flowers held within cupped, often colourful bracts

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow indoors in equal quantities of loam-based potting compost and grit in full light. Water moderately when in growth and keep dry in winter. In the growing season feed a low nitrogen liquid fertiliser 2 or 3 times. See houseplant cacti and succulent cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown at 15-18°C in early spring or stem cuttings in spring or early summer
how_to_grow.pruning: None required but can be cut back to restrict size
how_to_grow.pests: May be attacked by mealybugs, glasshouse whitefly and glasshouse red spider mite
how_to_grow.diseases: May suffer from powdery mildews and root rots
